intro: Strobilanthes longipetiolata, commonly known as the long-petioled flame flower, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular, red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and has lance-shaped leaves with long petioles. It produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators such as birds and insects. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
